utterance: Lawrence David: maybe to help or one way of synthesizing that to get what Carolina was asking about with the host and and then maybe also to address Darren's question. I was thinking that part of the problem might be that um like we often have a like a decent amount of microbiome data across a lot of populations and then there are some sub cohorts where you have um information about the brain or cognition or neurological function and there will be microbiome data for that. But I I think that that's a relatively narrow segment of what we know about the microbiome. So it feels like if if money was not an object and like you could actually do what you wanted to do, it would be incredible where there was just more standardized like collection of cognitive or neurological data from, you know, all of the microbiome studies that are done because I think then you would start to be able to figure out exactly like what might some of these like species level interactions be that ultimately like have a bearing on things like yeah, like cognition and behavior.
